title: Strategic Business Plan Generator
description: Create comprehensive 3-5 year strategic business plans with market analysis and financial projections
content: Act as a senior strategy consultant. Create a strategic business plan for [COMPANY_NAME] in [INDUSTRY]. Include executive summary, market analysis (size: [MARKET_SIZE], growth trends, competitive landscape), strategic objectives for 3-5 years (revenue target: [REVENUE_TARGET]), competitive positioning with SWOT analysis, operational strategy, financial projections with ROI expectations, risk assessment with mitigation strategies, and implementation roadmap with key milestones. Make it data-driven and actionable.

title: Crisis Communication Plan
description: Develop crisis communication strategy for executive teams during emergencies
content: You are a crisis communication expert. Develop a comprehensive crisis communication plan for [COMPANY_NAME] facing [CRISIS_TYPE]. Create: 1) Immediate response strategy (first 24 hours), 2) Stakeholder communication matrix (employees, customers, media, investors), 3) Key messaging framework addressing concerns, 4) Media response protocols, 5) Internal communication channels, 6) Social media management approach, 7) Recovery and reputation rebuilding strategy, 8) Lessons learned documentation process. Include specific templates for press releases, employee communications, and social media posts.

title: Board Meeting Presentation Builder
description: Create executive-level board presentations with key metrics and strategic insights
content: Act as a senior executive preparing for a board meeting. Create a comprehensive board presentation for [QUARTER/PERIOD] covering: 1) Executive Summary with key achievements and challenges, 2) Financial Performance (revenue: [REVENUE], profit margins, cash flow), 3) Strategic Initiative Updates on [KEY_PROJECTS], 4) Market Position and Competitive Analysis, 5) Risk Management and Mitigation Strategies, 6) Future Outlook and Opportunities, 7) Resource Requirements and Investment Needs, 8) Stakeholder Impact Assessment. Format for maximum impact with clear visuals, concise messaging, and actionable recommendations for board decision-making.

title: Clinical Differential Diagnosis Assistant
description: Systematic approach to differential diagnosis with evidence-based reasoning
content: Act as an experienced clinician. Provide systematic differential diagnosis for patient: Age [AGE], Gender [GENDER], Chief Complaint: [CHIEF_COMPLAINT], HPI: [HPI], PMH: [PMH], Medications: [MEDICATIONS], Physical Exam: [PHYSICAL_EXAM], Vitals: [VITALS]. Provide: 1) Primary differential (top 5 likely conditions with rationale), 2) Secondary considerations (less likely but important), 3) Recommended diagnostic workup (labs, imaging, consultations), 4) Red flags requiring immediate attention, 5) Initial management considerations. Include evidence-based reasoning and follow current medical guidelines. Note: For educational purposes only.

title: Medical Case Presentation Generator
description: Structure professional medical case presentations for rounds and conferences
content: Create a comprehensive medical case presentation for [PATIENT_TYPE] with [CONDITION]. Structure as: 1) **Chief Complaint & HPI**: Clear chronological history, 2) **Review of Systems**: Pertinent positives and negatives, 3) **Past Medical/Surgical History**: Relevant background, 4) **Physical Examination**: Organized by systems with key findings, 5) **Assessment & Plan**: Problem-based approach with differential diagnosis, diagnostic reasoning, and treatment plan, 6) **Discussion Points**: Teaching points, literature review, and clinical pearls, 7) **Follow-up Plan**: Monitoring and reassessment strategy. Format for medical education and professional rounds presentation.

title: Treatment Protocol Developer
description: Create evidence-based treatment protocols for medical conditions
content: Develop an evidence-based treatment protocol for [CONDITION] in [PATIENT_POPULATION]. Include: 1) **Clinical Guidelines**: Latest evidence-based recommendations, 2) **Diagnostic Criteria**: Clear inclusion/exclusion criteria, 3) **Treatment Algorithm**: Step-by-step decision tree, 4) **Medication Protocols**: Dosing, monitoring, side effects, 5) **Non-pharmacological Interventions**: Therapy, lifestyle modifications, 6) **Monitoring Parameters**: Laboratory values, clinical assessments, 7) **Complications Management**: Recognition and treatment, 8) **Patient Education**: Key counseling points, 9) **Follow-up Schedule**: Timing and assessments, 10) **Quality Metrics**: Outcome measures and benchmarks. Base on current medical literature and professional guidelines.

title: Contract Risk Analysis Framework
description: Comprehensive legal contract analysis identifying risks and negotiation points
content: Perform comprehensive contract risk analysis for [CONTRACT_TYPE] between [PARTY_1] and [PARTY_2], value [CONTRACT_VALUE], jurisdiction [JURISDICTION]. Analyze: 1) **Executive Summary**: Overall risk level and key recommendations, 2) **Risk Assessment**: High/medium/low risk issues with specific concerns, 3) **Legal Obligations**: Each party's duties, deadlines, and performance standards, 4) **Financial Risk**: Payment terms, penalties, liability limitations, indemnification, 5) **Operational Risk**: Force majeure, termination rights, change management, dispute resolution, 6) **Negotiation Points**: Must-have changes, preferred modifications, alternative language, 7) **Compliance Monitoring**: KPIs, audit requirements, reporting obligations, 8) **Next Steps**: Immediate actions and approval timeline.

title: Legal Research Assistant
description: Comprehensive legal research and case law analysis
content: Conduct comprehensive legal research on [LEGAL_ISSUE] in [JURISDICTION]. Research should include: 1) **Statutory Analysis**: Relevant statutes, regulations, and ordinances with current amendments, 2) **Case Law Review**: Key precedential cases, holdings, and legal reasoning, 3) **Legal Standards**: Applicable tests, standards of review, and burden of proof, 4) **Recent Developments**: Current trends, pending legislation, regulatory changes, 5) **Jurisdictional Comparison**: How other jurisdictions handle similar issues, 6) **Practice Considerations**: Practical implications, common pitfalls, strategic considerations, 7) **Citation Format**: Proper legal citation for all sources, 8) **Risk Assessment**: Likelihood of success, potential obstacles, alternative approaches. Organize findings in memorandum format with clear legal analysis and practical recommendations.

title: Compliance Framework Builder
description: Develop comprehensive regulatory compliance programs
content: Create a comprehensive compliance framework for [INDUSTRY] organization dealing with [REGULATORY_AREA]. Framework should include: 1) **Regulatory Mapping**: All applicable laws, regulations, and standards, 2) **Risk Assessment Matrix**: High/medium/low risk areas with impact analysis, 3) **Policy Development**: Written policies and procedures for each compliance area, 4) **Training Program**: Employee education, certification requirements, ongoing training, 5) **Monitoring & Auditing**: Internal controls, audit procedures, reporting mechanisms, 6) **Incident Response**: Violation handling, reporting requirements, corrective actions, 7) **Documentation Requirements**: Record keeping, retention policies, audit trails, 8) **Performance Metrics**: KPIs, compliance dashboards, regular reporting, 9) **Vendor Management**: Third-party compliance requirements, 10) **Continuous Improvement**: Regular updates, regulatory change management.

title: Investment Due Diligence Analyzer
description: Comprehensive financial due diligence for investment opportunities
content: Conduct comprehensive due diligence analysis for investment in [COMPANY_NAME] in [INDUSTRY], investment amount [INVESTMENT_AMOUNT]. Analysis should cover: 1) **Financial Analysis**: Revenue trends, profitability, cash flow analysis, debt structure, working capital management, 2) **Market Analysis**: Market size, growth potential, competitive position, market share trends, 3) **Business Model Evaluation**: Revenue streams, cost structure, scalability, competitive advantages, 4) **Management Assessment**: Team experience, track record, organizational structure, key person risk, 5) **Risk Analysis**: Market risks, operational risks, financial risks, regulatory risks, technology risks, 6) **Valuation Analysis**: Multiple valuation methods, comparable transactions, sensitivity analysis, 7) **Strategic Considerations**: Synergies, integration challenges, exit strategy, 8) **Legal & Compliance**: Corporate structure, litigation, regulatory compliance, IP portfolio, 9) **Recommendation**: Investment thesis, deal terms, monitoring requirements.

title: Financial Model Builder
description: Create comprehensive financial models for business planning and analysis
content: Build a comprehensive 5-year financial model for [COMPANY_NAME] in [INDUSTRY]. Model should include: 1) **Revenue Model**: Revenue streams, pricing strategy, volume assumptions, seasonal adjustments, growth rates, 2) **Cost Structure**: Fixed costs, variable costs, cost of goods sold, operating expenses with inflation adjustments, 3) **Staffing Model**: Headcount planning, salary assumptions, benefits, equity compensation, 4) **Capital Requirements**: Working capital needs, capital expenditures, financing requirements, 5) **Financial Statements**: P&L, balance sheet, cash flow statement with monthly/quarterly/annual views, 6) **Key Metrics**: Unit economics, LTV/CAC, gross margins, EBITDA, cash burn, runway, 7) **Scenario Analysis**: Base case, optimistic case, pessimistic case with sensitivity analysis, 8) **Funding Requirements**: Cash flow timing, funding rounds, use of funds, dilution analysis, 9) **Valuation Framework**: Multiple valuation approaches, exit scenarios, return calculations.

title: Risk Assessment Framework
description: Comprehensive financial risk analysis and mitigation strategies
content: Develop comprehensive risk assessment for [ORGANIZATION] in [SECTOR]. Framework should address: 1) **Market Risk**: Interest rate risk, currency risk, commodity price risk, market volatility impact, 2) **Credit Risk**: Counterparty risk, concentration risk, default probability analysis, credit loss provisions, 3) **Operational Risk**: Process failures, system risks, human error, fraud risk, business continuity, 4) **Liquidity Risk**: Cash flow analysis, funding sources, stress testing, contingency planning, 5) **Regulatory Risk**: Compliance requirements, regulatory changes, penalty exposure, reporting obligations, 6) **Strategic Risk**: Business model risks, competitive threats, technology disruption, reputation risk, 7) **Risk Quantification**: Value at Risk (VaR), stress testing, scenario analysis, Monte Carlo simulations, 8) **Risk Mitigation**: Control measures, insurance, hedging strategies, diversification, 9) **Risk Monitoring**: KRIs, dashboards, regular reporting, escalation procedures, 10) **Risk Governance**: Risk committee structure, roles and responsibilities, risk culture.

title: Software Architecture Design Assistant
description: Design scalable software architecture for complex applications
content: Design comprehensive software architecture for [APPLICATION_TYPE] handling [USER_SCALE] users. Architecture should include: 1) **System Overview**: High-level architecture diagram, key components, data flow, 2) **Frontend Architecture**: UI framework choice, state management, component structure, responsive design considerations, 3) **Backend Services**: Microservices design, API architecture, service communication patterns, 4) **Database Design**: Data modeling, database choice (SQL/NoSQL), sharding strategy, caching layers, 5) **Infrastructure**: Cloud platform, containerization, orchestration, CI/CD pipeline, 6) **Security Architecture**: Authentication/authorization, data encryption, network security, vulnerability management, 7) **Performance & Scalability**: Load balancing, auto-scaling, performance monitoring, optimization strategies, 8) **Reliability**: Fault tolerance, disaster recovery, backup strategies, monitoring and alerting, 9) **Technology Stack**: Justified technology choices, integration patterns, third-party services, 10) **Implementation Roadmap**: Development phases, milestones, resource requirements, timeline.

title: Code Review Assistant
description: Comprehensive code review focusing on best practices and optimization
content: Perform detailed code review for [PROGRAMMING_LANGUAGE] code implementing [FUNCTIONALITY]. Review should cover: 1) **Code Quality**: Readability, maintainability, documentation, naming conventions, code structure, 2) **Performance Analysis**: Algorithm efficiency, memory usage, database queries, network calls, caching opportunities, 3) **Security Review**: Input validation, SQL injection prevention, XSS protection, authentication/authorization, data sanitization, 4) **Best Practices**: Design patterns, SOLID principles, DRY principle, error handling, logging, 5) **Testing**: Unit test coverage, integration tests, test quality, edge cases, 6) **Architecture Compliance**: Adherence to architectural patterns, separation of concerns, dependency injection, 7) **Scalability Considerations**: Performance under load, resource usage, bottleneck identification, 8) **Bug Detection**: Logic errors, edge cases, race conditions, memory leaks, 9) **Refactoring Suggestions**: Code improvements, optimization opportunities, technical debt reduction, 10) **Action Items**: Prioritized list of improvements, critical issues, nice-to-have enhancements.

title: Technical Documentation Generator
description: Create comprehensive technical documentation for software projects
content: Create comprehensive technical documentation for [PROJECT_NAME] - [PROJECT_DESCRIPTION]. Documentation should include: 1) **Project Overview**: Purpose, scope, key features, target audience, high-level architecture, 2) **Getting Started**: Prerequisites, installation instructions, initial setup, quick start guide, 3) **API Documentation**: Endpoint descriptions, request/response formats, authentication, error codes, rate limits, 4) **Architecture Guide**: System components, data flow, integration points, security model, 5) **Database Schema**: Entity relationships, table structures, indexing strategy, migration scripts, 6) **Configuration**: Environment variables, configuration files, deployment settings, feature flags, 7) **Development Guide**: Local development setup, coding standards, testing procedures, contribution guidelines, 8) **Operations**: Deployment procedures, monitoring, logging, troubleshooting, performance tuning, 9) **Security**: Authentication, authorization, data protection, security best practices, 10) **Troubleshooting**: Common issues, error messages, debugging techniques, FAQ section.

title: Enterprise Sales Proposal Generator
description: Create compelling enterprise sales proposals with ROI analysis
content: Create comprehensive enterprise sales proposal for [PROSPECT_COMPANY] in [INDUSTRY] for [SOLUTION_TYPE] valued at [DEAL_SIZE]. Proposal should include: 1) **Executive Summary**: Business case, key benefits, investment overview, expected ROI, 2) **Situation Analysis**: Current state challenges, pain points, business impact, competitive landscape, 3) **Proposed Solution**: Detailed solution overview, technical specifications, implementation approach, timeline, 4) **Business Value**: ROI calculation, cost savings, revenue impact, productivity gains, risk mitigation, 5) **Implementation Plan**: Project phases, milestones, resource requirements, timeline, change management, 6) **Pricing Structure**: Detailed pricing, payment terms, financing options, contract structure, 7) **Risk Mitigation**: Identified risks, mitigation strategies, contingency plans, success guarantees, 8) **Success Metrics**: KPIs, measurement framework, reporting structure, success criteria, 9) **Next Steps**: Decision timeline, implementation kickoff, stakeholder approvals, contract execution, 10) **Appendices**: Technical specifications, case studies, references, team bios.

title: Sales Discovery Call Framework
description: Structured approach to sales discovery calls with qualifying questions
content: Create comprehensive discovery call framework for [PROSPECT_TYPE] in [INDUSTRY] for [SOLUTION_CATEGORY]. Framework should include: 1) **Pre-Call Research**: Company background, recent news, key stakeholders, competitive landscape, potential pain points, 2) **Opening & Rapport**: Introductions, agenda setting, expectations alignment, relationship building, 3) **Current State Assessment**: Existing solutions, processes, challenges, resource allocation, decision-making criteria, 4) **Pain Point Discovery**: Business challenges, impact quantification, root cause analysis, urgency factors, 5) **Future State Vision**: Desired outcomes, success criteria, timeline expectations, budget considerations, 6) **Decision Process**: Decision makers, evaluation criteria, budget approval process, implementation timeline, 7) **Competition Analysis**: Alternatives being considered, previous vendor experiences, selection criteria, 8) **Qualifying Questions**: Budget range, authority level, need intensity, timeline urgency, 9) **Next Steps**: Follow-up actions, proposal timeline, stakeholder introductions, evaluation process, 10) **Call Summary**: Key insights, action items, opportunity assessment, proposal recommendations.

title: Objection Handling Playbook
description: Comprehensive responses to common sales objections with persuasive techniques
content: Develop objection handling playbook for [PRODUCT_SERVICE] targeting [CUSTOMER_SEGMENT]. Address common objections: 1) **Price Objections**: "Too expensive", "Over budget", "Need to compare prices" - Include value reinforcement, cost-benefit analysis, ROI demonstration, payment flexibility, 2) **Authority Objections**: "Need to check with boss", "Not the decision maker" - Include stakeholder mapping, champion development, decision process navigation, 3) **Need Objections**: "Don't need it now", "Happy with current solution" - Include pain amplification, opportunity cost, competitive disadvantage, 4) **Trust Objections**: "Never heard of your company", "Unsure about vendor" - Include credibility building, social proof, reference customers, guarantees, 5) **Timing Objections**: "Not the right time", "Too busy" - Include urgency creation, cost of delay, seasonal factors, 6) **Feature Objections**: "Missing key feature", "Doesn't do what we need" - Include feature education, workaround solutions, roadmap commitments, 7) **Competition Objections**: "Looking at competitor X" - Include competitive differentiation, unique value props, switching costs, 8) **Response Framework**: Listen, acknowledge, clarify, respond, confirm understanding, 9) **Follow-up Strategy**: Objection documentation, response refinement, stakeholder education.

title: Content Marketing Strategy
description: Comprehensive content marketing strategy for lead generation and brand building
content: Develop comprehensive content marketing strategy for [COMPANY_NAME] targeting [TARGET_AUDIENCE] in [INDUSTRY]. Strategy should include: 1) **Audience Research**: Persona development, pain points, content preferences, buying journey mapping, channel preferences, 2) **Content Audit**: Existing content assessment, performance analysis, gap identification, competitive content analysis, 3) **Content Strategy**: Content pillars, topic clusters, content types, editorial calendar, SEO strategy, 4) **Content Production**: Content formats (blogs, videos, podcasts, infographics), production workflow, quality standards, brand guidelines, 5) **Distribution Strategy**: Owned channels (website, email), earned channels (PR, influencers), paid channels (social ads, PPC), 6) **SEO Integration**: Keyword research, on-page optimization, link building, technical SEO, content optimization, 7) **Social Media Strategy**: Platform selection, posting schedule, engagement strategy, community building, 8) **Performance Metrics**: Content KPIs, lead generation metrics, engagement metrics, brand awareness metrics, 9) **Content Governance**: Approval processes, brand compliance, legal review, content archiving, 10) **Budget & Resources**: Content creation costs, tool requirements, team structure, outsourcing strategy.

title: Digital Marketing Campaign Planner
description: Plan and execute comprehensive digital marketing campaigns across channels
content: Create comprehensive digital marketing campaign for [CAMPAIGN_OBJECTIVE] targeting [TARGET_AUDIENCE] with budget [BUDGET_AMOUNT]. Campaign plan should include: 1) **Campaign Objectives**: Primary goals, success metrics, KPIs, target outcomes, timeline, 2) **Audience Strategy**: Demographic targeting, psychographic profiles, behavioral targeting, lookalike audiences, 3) **Channel Strategy**: Platform selection (Google Ads, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok), budget allocation, creative requirements, 4) **Creative Strategy**: Ad formats, messaging themes, visual concepts, A/B testing plan, brand guidelines, 5) **Landing Page Strategy**: Landing page design, conversion optimization, user experience, mobile optimization, 6) **Email Marketing**: Email sequences, segmentation strategy, automation workflows, personalization, 7) **Content Calendar**: Campaign timeline, content production schedule, approval processes, publication dates, 8) **Budget Management**: Channel budget allocation, bid strategies, cost management, performance optimization, 9) **Analytics Setup**: Conversion tracking, attribution modeling, analytics configuration, reporting dashboard, 10) **Performance Monitoring**: Daily optimization, A/B testing, budget reallocation, campaign refinement.

title: Job Description Creator
description: Create compelling job descriptions that attract top talent
content: Create comprehensive job description for [JOB_TITLE] position at [COMPANY_NAME] in [DEPARTMENT]. Include: 1) **Role Overview**: Position summary, reporting structure, team size, key relationships, 2) **Responsibilities**: Primary duties, day-to-day activities, project ownership, collaboration requirements, 3) **Qualifications**: Required education, experience, skills, certifications, preferred qualifications, 4) **Skills & Competencies**: Technical skills, soft skills, leadership requirements, communication skills, 5) **Success Metrics**: Performance indicators, goals, expectations, career progression, 6) **Company Culture**: Values, work environment, team dynamics, growth opportunities, 7) **Compensation**: Salary range, benefits package, equity, performance bonuses, 8) **Location**: Office requirements, remote options, travel expectations, 9) **Application Process**: How to apply, required documents, interview process, timeline, 10) **Legal Compliance**: Equal opportunity statement, accommodation notice, background check requirements. Write in engaging tone to attract top talent while being specific about requirements.

title: Performance Review Framework
description: Structured approach to employee performance evaluations and development planning
content: Create comprehensive performance review framework for [EMPLOYEE_NAME] in [POSITION] for [REVIEW_PERIOD]. Framework should include: 1) **Performance Summary**: Overall performance rating, key achievements, areas of excellence, improvement areas, 2) **Goal Assessment**: Review of previous period goals, achievement level, challenges faced, outcomes delivered, 3) **Core Competencies**: Evaluation of job-specific skills, leadership abilities, communication, teamwork, problem-solving, 4) **Professional Development**: Skills assessment, learning opportunities, career interests, development needs, 5) **Feedback Collection**: 360-degree feedback, peer input, customer feedback, self-assessment, 6) **Goal Setting**: SMART goals for next period, career development objectives, skill building targets, 7) **Development Plan**: Training needs, mentorship opportunities, stretch assignments, skill development, 8) **Career Discussion**: Career aspirations, promotion readiness, succession planning, mobility interests, 9) **Recognition**: Achievements to celebrate, contributions to acknowledge, success stories, 10) **Action Items**: Development activities, follow-up meetings, resource allocation, progress checkpoints.

title: Management Consulting Framework
description: Structured approach to business problem solving using consulting methodologies
content: Apply management consulting framework to analyze [BUSINESS_PROBLEM] for [CLIENT_NAME] in [INDUSTRY]. Analysis should follow: 1) **Problem Definition**: Issue statement, scope boundaries, success criteria, stakeholder impact, root cause hypothesis, 2) **Situation Assessment**: Current state analysis, market dynamics, competitive position, internal capabilities, external factors, 3) **Framework Selection**: Choose appropriate framework (Porter's 5 Forces, McKinsey 7S, BCG Matrix, etc.), rationale for selection, 4) **Data Collection**: Information requirements, data sources, interview plan, survey design, benchmarking approach, 5) **Analysis & Insights**: Quantitative analysis, qualitative insights, pattern identification, hypothesis testing, implications, 6) **Solution Development**: Alternative solutions, pros/cons analysis, implementation feasibility, resource requirements, 7) **Recommendation**: Preferred solution, implementation roadmap, risk mitigation, success metrics, business case, 8) **Implementation Planning**: Project plan, resource allocation, timeline, governance structure, change management, 9) **Stakeholder Communication**: Executive summary, detailed findings, presentation materials, discussion guides, 10) **Follow-up Strategy**: Progress monitoring, course correction, value realization, continuous improvement.

title: Process Improvement Analysis
description: Systematic approach to identifying and implementing process improvements
content: Conduct process improvement analysis for [PROCESS_NAME] at [ORGANIZATION] in [DEPARTMENT]. Analysis should include: 1) **Current State Mapping**: Process documentation, workflow visualization, stakeholder roles, system touchpoints, performance metrics, 2) **Pain Point Identification**: Bottlenecks, inefficiencies, quality issues, customer complaints, cost drivers, 3) **Root Cause Analysis**: 5-whys technique, fishbone diagram, statistical analysis, stakeholder interviews, 4) **Benchmarking**: Industry best practices, competitor analysis, internal comparisons, performance standards, 5) **Future State Design**: Ideal process flow, automation opportunities, role optimization, system integration, 6) **Gap Analysis**: Current vs. future state, capability gaps, resource requirements, technology needs, 7) **Implementation Roadmap**: Project phases, quick wins, long-term improvements, resource allocation, timeline, 8) **Change Management**: Communication plan, training requirements, resistance management, adoption strategy, 9) **Performance Metrics**: KPIs, measurement framework, reporting structure, continuous monitoring, 10) **Business Case**: Investment requirements, expected benefits, ROI calculation, risk assessment, payback period.

title: Product Requirements Document (PRD)
description: Comprehensive product requirements for new feature or product development
content: Create comprehensive PRD for [PRODUCT_FEATURE] targeting [USER_SEGMENT]. Document should include: 1) **Executive Summary**: Feature overview, business rationale, success metrics, resource requirements, 2) **Problem Statement**: User problems, market opportunity, competitive gap, business impact, 3) **User Research**: User personas, use cases, user journey mapping, pain points, behavioral insights, 4) **Requirements**: Functional requirements, non-functional requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, edge cases, 5) **Design Specifications**: UI/UX requirements, wireframes, user flows, accessibility, responsive design, 6) **Technical Specifications**: Architecture requirements, API specifications, performance requirements, security considerations, 7) **Success Metrics**: KPIs, analytics tracking, A/B testing plan, success criteria, measurement framework, 8) **Timeline & Milestones**: Development phases, key milestones, dependencies, resource allocation, 9) **Risk Assessment**: Technical risks, market risks, resource risks, mitigation strategies, 10) **Launch Plan**: Go-to-market strategy, rollout plan, communication strategy, support preparation, post-launch monitoring.

title: User Story Generator
description: Create detailed user stories with acceptance criteria for agile development
content: Generate comprehensive user stories for [FEATURE_NAME] serving [USER_TYPE]. Each story should include: 1) **User Story Format**: "As a [user type], I want [functionality] so that [benefit]" - clear, concise, user-focused, 2) **Acceptance Criteria**: Given-When-Then format, specific conditions, expected behaviors, edge cases, 3) **Definition of Done**: Quality standards, testing requirements, documentation needs, review criteria, 4) **Story Points**: Complexity estimation, effort assessment, dependency consideration, 5) **Priority Ranking**: Business value, user impact, technical dependency, urgency, 6) **Mockups/Wireframes**: Visual representation, user interface elements, interaction flows, 7) **Technical Notes**: Implementation considerations, API requirements, database changes, performance implications, 8) **Testing Strategy**: Unit tests, integration tests, user acceptance tests, automated testing, 9) **Dependencies**: Related stories, external dependencies, prerequisite work, blocking issues, 10) **Success Metrics**: User engagement, feature adoption, performance metrics, business impact. Organize stories into epics and maintain traceability to business objectives.

title: Data Analysis Report Generator
description: Comprehensive data analysis with insights and actionable recommendations
content: Create comprehensive data analysis report for [DATASET_DESCRIPTION] focusing on [ANALYSIS_OBJECTIVE]. Report should include: 1) **Executive Summary**: Key findings, primary insights, actionable recommendations, business impact, 2) **Data Overview**: Data sources, collection methods, time period, sample size, data quality assessment, 3) **Methodology**: Analysis approach, statistical methods, tools used, assumptions made, limitations, 4) **Descriptive Statistics**: Summary statistics, distributions, central tendencies, variability measures, 5) **Trend Analysis**: Time series patterns, seasonal variations, growth rates, anomaly detection, 6) **Correlation Analysis**: Relationship identification, correlation coefficients, causation vs correlation, 7) **Segmentation Analysis**: Customer segments, behavioral patterns, demographic analysis, performance by segment, 8) **Predictive Insights**: Forecasting, trend projections, scenario modeling, confidence intervals, 9) **Visualizations**: Charts, graphs, dashboards, heat maps, geographic analysis, 10) **Recommendations**: Data-driven insights, business implications, next steps, further analysis needs, implementation priorities. Include statistical significance testing and confidence levels.

title: Dashboard Design Specifications
description: Design specifications for business intelligence dashboards and KPI tracking
content: Create comprehensive dashboard specifications for [DASHBOARD_PURPOSE] serving [STAKEHOLDER_GROUP]. Specifications should include: 1) **Dashboard Objectives**: Primary goals, key questions to answer, decision support requirements, user needs, 2) **User Personas**: Dashboard users, their roles, technical proficiency, usage patterns, access requirements, 3) **KPI Framework**: Key metrics, calculation methods, benchmarks, targets, alert thresholds, 4) **Data Requirements**: Data sources, update frequency, data quality requirements, historical data needs, 5) **Layout Design**: Dashboard structure, widget arrangement, visual hierarchy, responsive design, 6) **Visualization Types**: Chart selection rationale, color schemes, interactive elements, drill-down capabilities, 7) **Filtering & Controls**: Filter options, date ranges, comparison periods, export functions, 8) **Performance Requirements**: Load times, refresh rates, data volume capacity, concurrent users, 9) **Access Control**: User permissions, role-based access, data security, compliance requirements, 10) **Technical Specifications**: Platform requirements, integration needs, mobile compatibility, browser support, 11) **Testing Plan**: User acceptance testing, performance testing, data validation, 12) **Training & Documentation**: User guides, training materials, support documentation.

title: Customer Onboarding Playbook
description: Structured customer onboarding process to ensure successful product adoption
content: Create comprehensive customer onboarding playbook for [PRODUCT_SERVICE] targeting [CUSTOMER_SEGMENT]. Playbook should include: 1) **Onboarding Objectives**: Success criteria, time to value, adoption milestones, retention goals, 2) **Customer Journey Mapping**: Onboarding phases, touchpoints, customer emotions, support needs, 3) **Pre-Onboarding**: Welcome sequence, expectation setting, resource preparation, team introductions, 4) **Initial Setup**: Account configuration, user provisioning, integration setup, customization, 5) **Training Program**: User training modules, admin training, best practices, certification program, 6) **Implementation Support**: Technical setup, data migration, workflow configuration, testing procedures, 7) **Milestone Tracking**: Progress checkpoints, success metrics, risk identification, intervention triggers, 8) **Communication Strategy**: Regular check-ins, progress updates, escalation procedures, feedback collection, 9) **Resource Library**: Documentation, video tutorials, FAQs, community forums, support contacts, 10) **Success Measurement**: Adoption metrics, user engagement, satisfaction scores, time to value, 11) **Risk Management**: Early warning signs, churn prevention, recovery strategies, 12) **Post-Onboarding**: Advanced features, expansion opportunities, advocacy development.

title: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) Creator
description: Create detailed standard operating procedures for business processes
content: Create comprehensive SOP for [PROCESS_NAME] in [DEPARTMENT] at [ORGANIZATION]. SOP should include: 1) **Process Overview**: Purpose, scope, objectives, process owner, stakeholders, 2) **Prerequisites**: Required skills, tools, systems access, permissions, preparation steps, 3) **Step-by-Step Instructions**: Detailed procedures, decision points, conditional logic, quality checks, 4) **Roles & Responsibilities**: Task assignments, approval authorities, escalation paths, accountability, 5) **Tools & Resources**: Required software, equipment, templates, reference materials, 6) **Quality Standards**: Acceptance criteria, quality metrics, inspection points, error prevention, 7) **Documentation Requirements**: Records to maintain, reporting obligations, audit trails, retention policies, 8) **Exception Handling**: Error scenarios, troubleshooting guide, escalation procedures, recovery steps, 9) **Performance Metrics**: Process KPIs, efficiency measures, quality indicators, success criteria, 10) **Training Requirements**: Skill prerequisites, certification needs, competency assessment, ongoing training, 11) **Compliance Considerations**: Regulatory requirements, policy adherence, audit requirements, 12) **Review & Updates**: Review schedule, update procedures, version control, change management.
